clues.text: He reigned from 1066 to 1087 & one of those years should really help you

(Hi, I'm Bill Ritter from New York's ABC7 [He presents from Queens, NY].) Philip Johnson designed the soaring towers of the New York State Pavilion at the 1964 World's Fair in the futuristic Googie style which fit perfectly inthis1997 film that featured them

Appropriately, it has a state bluegrass song, "Blue Moon of" itself

JK: only a joke

(I'm Anne Elise Park with TXA21. [She presents from the George W. Bush Presidential Library in Dallas, Texas].) George W. Bush's Oval Office is one setting for the movie "W.", directed bythisman who entered Yale the same year as Bush
He led from 1799 to 1814, took an unwanted vacation, returned & then was gone for good in 1815
MT for short, this magazine for car enthusiasts celebrated its 70th anniversary in 2019

ROTFL: you've made me hysterical

Nicknamed "Uncle", this Communist was a leader in Vietnam from 1945 to 1969
In 2010 this mayoral name began appearing above "Businessweek" on a magazine that's been around since 1929

OT: not pertaining to the issue at hand
